materials: Caron® Big Donut O’Go ™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 502 yds / 459 m) Lemon Plum (29002)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop
Scbp = Draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
Splsc = Insert hook between 2 strands of vertical V in the middle of sc instead of usual way. Draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
Splsc2tog = Draw up a loop between 2 strands of vertical V in the middle of each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Mittens: To Fit Adult palm 8" [20.5 cm]; Hat: To fit size adult head 22½" [57 cm]
gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook; 14 splsc and 14 rnds = 4" [10 cm] with U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D and E.
• Start crocheting!
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use.

SHANNON MITTENS

Ribbing
With A and smaller hook, ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Join ribbing in rnd: With WS facing, fold the cuff lengthwise in half, placing chain edge in front of last row. *Working through both thicknesses of foundation chain and back loops of last row, sl st in each st to end of row.

HAND
Change to larger hook.
1st set-up rnd: With A, ch 1. Work 28 sc evenly around top edge of Ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd set-up rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbp around each sc. Join with sl st to first scbp.
Notes: Do not join at ends of rnds. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.

1st rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around. Do not join in rnd.
1st rnd of Chart is complete. Cont in Chart in splsc until 6th row of chart have been complete, reading rnds from right to left.
Note: Work gusset sts with A only.
Chart is Shown on page 4.
Keeping cont of Chart, Shape Thumb Gusset as follows:
1st rnd: Work 7th row of Chart across first 13 sts. With A, 2 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Cont working 7th row of Chart to end of rnd. 30 sts.
Gusset sts and Chart are now in position.
2nd rnd: Work 8th row of Chart, noting 4 gusset sts in A.
3rd rnd: Work 9th row of Chart across first 13 sts. With A, 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. 2 splsc in next st. Cont working 9th row of Chart to end of rnd. 32 sts.
4th rnd: Work 10th row of Chart, noting 6 gusset sts in A.
5th rnd: Work 11th row of Chart across first 13 sts. With A, 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. 2 splsc in next st. Cont working 11th row of Chart to end of rnd. 34 sts.
6th rnd: Work 12th row of Chart, noting 8 gusset sts in A.
7th rnd: Work 13th row of Chart across first 13 sts. Ch 2. PM on 2nd ch. Skip next 8 sts. Cont working 13th row of Chart to end of rnd.
8th rnd: Work 14th row of Chart across first 13 sts. With appropriate color, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Cont working 14th row of Chart, work in splsc to end of Chart. Break color A of thumb gusset.
Continue working chart until 28th rnd of Chart will be complete.
Break B, C, D and E.

SHAPE TOP
Next 3 rnds: With A, 1 splsc in each st around.
Next rnd: (1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Splsc2tog) 7 times. 21 sts.
Next rnd: (1 splsc in next st. Splsc2tog) 6 times. 14 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

THUMB
Join A with sl st at marked ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 1 sc in last ch. 10 sc. PM for beg of rnd. Do not join. Cont working in spiral.
2nd rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until Thumb from marker measures 2" [5 cm].
Next rnd: (Splsc2tog) 5 times. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

SHANNON HAT

Ribbing
With A and smaller hook, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, without stretching, from beg measures 22” [56 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.

Join ribbing in rnd: With WS facing, fold the cuff lengthwise in half, placing chain edge in front of last row. *Working through both thicknesses of foundation chain and back loops of last row, sl st in each st to end of row.

BODY
Change to larger hook.
1st set-up rnd: With A, ch 1. Work 80 sc evenly around top edge of Ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd set-up rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbp around each sc around. Join with sl st to first st.
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
1st rnd: 1 splsc in each sc around. Do not join in rnd. 1st rnd of Chart is complete. Cont in Chart in splsc to end of chart, reading rnds from right to left noting 40-st rep will be worked twice. Break B, C, D and E at end of Chart.
Chart is shown on page 4.
SHAPE TOP
1st rnd: With A, (1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Splsc2tog) 20 times. 60 sts.
2nd rnd: (1 splsc in next st. Splsc2tog) 20 times. 40 sts.
3rd rnd: *Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
4th rnd: Splsc2tog. Rep from * around. 10 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: Caron® Latte Cakes™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 530 yds/485 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit average woman’s palm.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc. Make Left and Right Mittens Alike Cuff: Ch 20 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch. 1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdcfp around first st. *1 hdcbp around next st. 1 hdcfp around next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 hdcbp around last st. Join with sl st to first hdcfp. Rep 2nd rnd for 2" [5 cm]. Next 6 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Shape thumb gusset: Next rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sc. Rep last rnd 8 times more. 29 sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. Skip first 9 sc. 1 sc in each rem sc around. Join with sl st to ch-1 sp. 20 sc. Place marker on last sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marker measures 4" [10 cm]. Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure. Thumb: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at top of thumb gusset. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 9 more sc evenly spaced around opening. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Thumb measures 2" [5 cm]. Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure.

materials: Color A- #00009 Bright Navy: 4 ¾ oz [133 g]; 227 yds [205 m] or 2 balls
Color B - #00001 White: ½ oz [8 g]; 14 yds [13 m] or 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Each mitt measures approximately 12 x 7 inches [30.5 x 17.5 cm].
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Mitt Fronts and Backs (make 4 pieces alike)
With A, ch 24.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 23 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 5 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
9th row: Ch 13. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 29 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
12th to 14th rows: Rep 10th and 11th rows once more, then 10th row once.
15th to 20th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
22nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
23rd to 25th rows: Rep 21st and 22nd rows once more, then 21st row once. 29 sc.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

STAR (with B make 4)
Base: Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 20 sc. Join with sl st in first sc.
First Point: *Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2. Sl st along side of Point to Base. Rep from * 4 times more. 5 Points in total.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
With WS facing, pin 2 Mitt pieces tog. Join A with sl st to base of thumb section at side seam. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc around outer edge of Mitt to join 2 pieces tog, leaving bottom open. Work 1 rnd of sc around open bottom of Mitt. Ch 6 (loop). 1 sc in base of ch. Fasten off. Rep for second Mitt.
Sew Star to each Mitt as shown in picture.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Measurements: 5 (6)” (12.5 [15] cm) in circumference. 5½ (6½)” (14 [16.5] cm) long.
gauge: 18 sts and 12 rows in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
WRISTER (Make 2)
Leaving 12” (30.5 cm) tail, ch 26 (32). 
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—24 (30) dc. Fasten off.
Row 2: Ch 1, sl st in each st across, turn—24 (30) sl sts.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), working in front loops only, dc in each dc across, turn—24 (30) dc.
Repeat Rows 2–3 until piece measures 5 (6)” (12.5 [15] cm) from beginning, ending with Row 2 of pattern. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining Row: With wrong sides facing, fold piece in half, matching sts of last row with foundation ch, working through double thickness, join yarn with a slip st in first st of last row and corresponding foundation ch, slip st in each of next 11 (13) sts. Fasten off. Skip next 6 (8) sts for thumb opening. Working through double thickness, rejoin yarn with a slip st in next st, slip st in each of next 5 (7) sts. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 387 Soft Navy B and 984 Shaded Dusk C. (Child’s Version)
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 624 Tea Leaf A and 387 Soft Navy B. (Women’s Version)
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 624 Tea Leaf A. (Men’s Version)
abbreviations: sc2tog = [insert hook in next st, yo, draw yarn through st] twice, yo, draw yarn through all 3 loops on hook.
A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
measurements: Child size measures 6” around x 7½” long. Women’s size measures 7½” around x 11½” long. Men’s size measures 9½” around x 12” long.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 17 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Cuff
Using C (B, A), ch 15 (21, 24).
Row 1: Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, ch 1, turn.
Repeat Row 1 for a total of 18 (22, 24) rows.
Fold cuff in half and join ends with slip st to form cuff. Do not fasten off.
Hand
Round 1: Working along row ends on cuff, slip st evenly around for 18 (22, 26) sts, join round with slip st.
Round 2: Ch 1, place marker, [sc in next 8 (10, 12) sts, 2 sc in next st] twice. Join with slip st  [20 (24, 28) sts].
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next 9 (11, 13) sts, 2 sc in next st] twice. Join with slip st [22 (26, 30) sts].
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 10 (12, 14) sts, 2 sc in next st] twice. Join with slip st [24 (28, 32) sts].
Child’s size: Proceed to next step.
Women’s size: Ch 1, [sc in next 13 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice. Join with slip st (30 sts).
Men’s size: Ch 1, [sc in next 15 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice. Join with slip st (34 sts).
Repeat as established, working 1 more sc before increasing each round, for 2 more rounds (38 sts).
Thumb
Round 1: Join yarn to thumb opening at st closest to upper hand, ch 1, sc in each st around, joining with slip st  [8 (9, 12) sts]. Sc in each st around for 4 (7, 8) rounds.
Next round: Sc2tog, sc to 3 sts from last st, sc last 2 sts tog [6 (7, 10) sts]. Sc2tog around, working last st as sc on Women’s size [3 (4, 5) sts]. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Next Step: Continuing with stripe/solid pattern as set, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st. Repeat for a total of 1 (3, 3) rounds.
Thumb Opening
Next round: Ch 1, [sc in next 20 (26, 32) sts, ch 4 (5, 6), skip remaining sts and join with slip st to first st.
Upper Hand
Sc in each st around for 8 (10, 12) rounds [24 (31, 38) sts], decreasing 1 st on last round for Women’s size only [24 (30, 38) sts].
Round 1: [Sc 10 (13, 17), sc2tog] twice [22 (28, 36) sts].
Round 2: [Sc 9 (12, 16), sc2tog] twice [20 (26, 34) sts].
Round 3: [Sc 8 (11, 15), sc2tog] twice [18 (24, 32) sts].
Round 4: [Sc 7 (10, 14), sc2tog] twice [16 (22, 30) sts].
Child’s size only: Sc2tog around (8 sts), fasten off. Continue with thumb.
Round 5: Sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc 9 (13), sc2tog] twice [20 (28) sts].
Next 2 rounds: Sc2tog around [5 (7) sts]. Fasten off at end of last round.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Bamboo Crochet Thread” Size 3: 2 balls 0012 Black
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Wristers measure 15” long to thumb. Directions are for one size.
gauge: 12 sc and 8 ch spaces = 4”; 12 rows = 4” using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WRISTER
Fsc 41.
Row 1 (Right Side): (Ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in first fsc, * skip 3 fsc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next fsc; repeat from * across (11 shell groups).
Row 2: (Ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space, * (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
Working on the chain side of the fsc, rejoin yarn in first st (looks like a sc).
Row 1: Sc in first fsc, * ch 2, skip 1 fsc, sc in next fsc; repeat from * across (21 sc and 20 ch-2 spaces).
At end of row, join and begin working in the round:
Round 1: Sc in first sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 19 times more.
Rounds 2 – 8: Repeat Round 1.
Round 9: Sc in first sc, ch 1, sc in next sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 17 times more, ch 1, sc in last sc.
Round 10: Sc in first sc, (skip ch-1 space), sc in next sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 17 times more, skip last ch-1 space, sc in last sc.
Round 11: Sc in first sc, (skip next sc and ch-2 space), * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * across 16 times more (skip ch-2 space and next sc), ch 2, sc in last sc (19 sc).
Round 12: Sc in first sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 17 times more.
Rounds 13-23: Repeat Round 12.
Round 24: Sc in first sc, ch 1, sc in next sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 15 times more, ch 1, sc in last sc.
Round 25: Sc in first sc, (skip ch-1 space), sc in next sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 15 times more, skip last ch-1 space, sc in last sc.
Round 26: Sc in first sc, (skip next sc and ch-2 space), * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * across 14 times more (skip ch-2 space and next sc), ch 2, sc in last sc (17 sc).
Round 27: Sc in first sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 15 times more.
Rounds 28-41: Repeat Round 27.

Thumb Gusset
Round 42: Sc in first sc and in ch-2 space and next sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 13 times more, sc in ch-2 space and in last sc (19 sc).
Round 43: Sc in first sc, (ch 1, sc in next sc) twice, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 13 times more, (ch 1, sc in next sc) twice.
Round 44: Sc in first sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 17 times more.
Rounds 45 & 46: Repeat Round 44.
Divide for Thumb
Round 47: Sc in first sc, * ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 15 times more, ch 5, skip (ch 2, sc) twice and (sc, ch 2) twice, sc in next sc (new beginning of round).
Round 48: * Ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 13 times more; ch 2, skip 2 ch, sc in next ch, ch 2, sc in beginning sc.
Round 49: * Ch 2, sc in next sc; repeat from * 15 times more (last sc will be made in same sc as beginning of next round).
Change to smaller hook. In same sc as just worked Round 50: (Ch 2, dc, ch 2, 2 dc), * skip 1 sc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next sc; repeat from * around, join with a slip stitch in first shell’s ch-2 space.
Round 51: Ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in first ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in each ch-2 space around, join with a slip stitch to first dc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
If desired, weave elastic through each sc of beginning fsc, tie with a square knot. This is to keep the wrister in place above elbow.

materials: 1 skein 3972 Mulberry Mix of RED HEART® Super Saver®
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Length: 15½” (39.5 cm), Circumference of hand cuff: 8½” (23 cm), Circumference of arm cuff: 11” (30.5 cm)
gauge: 7 sts = 2” (5 cm); 6 rows = 2” (5 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
ARM WARMER (make 2)
Hand Cuff
Ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Rows 2–25: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 26: Working in both loops of opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across (cuff made), turn. Do not fasten off. 
Sleeve
Repeated rounds refer to sleeve rounds only.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in end of each row; join with slip st in first sc, turn—26 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2.
Round 5: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), working in back loops only, dc in each sc around; join with slip st in first dc, turn—26 dc.
Round 6: Ch 2, Bpdc around first dc, dc in next dc, *Bpdc around next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc, turn. 
Round 7: Ch 2, dc in first dc, Fpdc around next dc, *dc in next dc, Fpdc around next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc, turn.
Round 8: Ch 2, dc in first Fpdc, Bpdc around next dc, *dc in next Fpdc, Bpdc around next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc, turn. 
Round 9: Ch 2, Fpdc around first Bpdc, dc in next dc, *Fpdc around next Bpdc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc, turn. 
Rounds 10 and 11: Repeat Rounds 6 and 7.
Round 12: Repeat Round 2.
Round 13: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * twice, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn—30 sc.
Rounds 14–22: Repeat Rounds 4–12.
Round 23: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * twice, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc, turn—34 sc.
Round 24: Repeat Round 2.
Round 25: Repeat Round 3; do not turn or fasten off.
Arm Cuff
Row 1 (right side): Ch 9, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, slip st in first 2 sc of Round 25, turn—8 sc. 
Row 2: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, slip st in next 2 sc of Round 25, turn.
Rows 4–33: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 fifteen times.
Row 34: Repeat Row 2.
Row 35: Ch 1, working in back loops only of last row and in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each sc across. Fasten off. 
FINISHING  
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each 312 Black A and 722 Pretty ‘N Pink B
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
measurements: Wristers measure 7 (9)” [18 (23) cm] circumference at knuckles.
gauge: 12 sts and 12 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Top Edging
Row 1: Rotate to work along top of Wrister, work 22 (28) sc evenly across.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging 
Join A with slip st in first row end of bottom edge.
Rows 1-2: Repeat Rows 1-2 of Top Edging.
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, align stitches of Row 1 with Row 21 (27). Sew row ends of top edging together, sew first 3 sts of Wrister, skip next 5 sts on Wrister (thumb hold made), sew remaining 9 (13) sts on Wrister, sew bottom edging row ends. Weave in ends.
Directions are for a teen. Changes for an adult are in parentheses.
NOTE
1. Wristers are worked in turned rows, then seamed leaving opening for thumb.
2. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Carry old color loosely up side of piece until next needed. 
WRISTERS (Make 2)
With A, ch 18 (22).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across – 17 (21) sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc Back Loop Only in each st across. 
Rows 3-4: Repeat Row 2, changing to B in last st of Row 4.
Rows 5-6: Repeat Row 2, changing to A in last st of Row 6. 
Rows 7-10: Repeat Row 2, changing to B in last st of Row 10.
Rows 11-16 (22): Repeat Rows 5-10, 1 (2) time(s). 
Rows 17-18 (23-24): Repeat Rows 5-6.
Rows 19-21 (25-27): Repeat Row 2.
Do not fasten off.

materials: Hat, Scarf and Mittens Main Color (MC)(Aran) 3 balls
Sizes 4.5 mm (U.S. 7) crochet hook for Mittens
5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook for Hat and Scarf
measurements: One size to fit Average Lady, Scarf: Approx. 7½ ins [19 cm] wide x 50½ ins [128.5 cm] long
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 5.5 mm crochet hook.
instructions:
Hat
With larger hook and MC, ch 76. 
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 75 sc. Turn.  
**2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Draw up a loop in next sc. Ch 5. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook – picot sc made. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.  
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next st. Picot sc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. [Note: Push picot sc to the back (RS) of work]. Turn.**  
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 3 ins [7.5 cm] ending on a 2nd row. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook– sc2tog made. 74 sc. Join A to last st. Break MC. 
Reversing WS to RS for cuff turn-back, proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *[Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st 2 rows below inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice- 1 dcfp made] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 7 sts. (1 dcfp around next sc 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Ch 1. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in each st to end of row. Ch 1. Turn.
3rd row: 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *(1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 7 sts. (1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Ch 1. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until work from turn-back row measures 5 ins [12.5 cm] ending with RS facing for next row.
Shape top: 1st row: 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *(1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. (1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 67 sts.
2nd and alt rows: 1 sc in each st to end of row. Ch 1. Turn.
3rd row: 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. *(1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. (1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in last st. Ch 1. Turn. 51 sts.
5th row: 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. *(1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. (1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Ch 1. Turn. 43 sts.
7th row: 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. *(1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. (1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rows below) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in last st. Ch 1. Turn. 35 sts.
9th row: Sc2tog over first 2 sts. *(Yoh and draw up a loop from right to left around stem of next dcfp 2 rows below. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 1 dcfp3tog made. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. 16 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts and fasten securely. Sew center back seam. Fold lower edge to RS and tack in place at seam.
Earflaps (make 2)
With A and larger hook, ch 15. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 14 sc.  
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in last sc. 
4th row: As 2nd row. 
Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 
Proceed as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts) twice. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 10 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 9 sts.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 dcfp3tog around posts of each of next 3 sts 2 rows below. Miss next st. 1 dcfp3tog around posts of each of next 3 sts 2 rows below. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 4 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each st across. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Fasten off. 
Sew Earflaps to Hat as illustrated. 
Twisted cord: (Make 2). Cut 2 strands of A 23 ins [33 cm] long. With both strands tog hold one end and with someone holding other end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Adjust length if desired. Sew one twisted cord to point of each Earflap. 
Scarf
With MC and larger hook, ch 26. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 25 sc. Turn.  
Work from ** to ** as given for Hat.   
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 3½ ins [9 cm] ending on a 3rd row. Break MC.
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. [(1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc] twice. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows until work from beg measures 47 ins [119.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. 
Change to MC and work from ** to ** as given for Hat.   
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 50½ ins [128.5 cm] ending on a 3rd row. Fasten off. 
Mittens
Right Mitten
***With MC and smaller hook, 
ch 34. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 33 sc. Turn.  
Work from ** to ** as given for Hat.   
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm] ending on a 2nd row. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. 32 sc. Join A to last st. Break MC.*** 
Reversing WS to RS for cuff turn-back, proceed as follows:
1st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. (1 dcfp around post of next st 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Last 2 rows form ridge pat. 
Cont in ridge pat until Mitten above cuff measures 2½ ins [6 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. 
Keeping cont of ridge pat, proceed as follows to shape thumb gusset:
1st row: Ch 1. Pat 16 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st. Pat 16 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Pat 16 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Turn.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 1 ball each 530 Magenta A and 852 Navy B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Wristers measure 12” (30.5 cm) long by 8” (20.5 cm) in circumference.
gauge: 4 repeats and 7 rows dc in pattern = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch-1), dc in same ch, *skip 2 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch; repeat from * around, skip last 2 ch—8 repeats. Change color with B.
Round 2: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around. Change color with A.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2 using color A. Change color with B.
Round 4 (Thumb shaping): Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around to last repeat; ch 6 to form hole for thumb; change color with A—8 repeats, ch-6.
Round 5: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; work (dc, ch 1, dc; dc, ch 1, dc) in last ch-6; change color—10 repeats.
Round 6: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; change color.
Round 7: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around to last 2 repeats; dc in each ch-1 space; change color—8 repeats, 2 dc.
Round 8: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around to last 2 dc; dc2tog; change color—8 repeats, dc2tog.
Round 9: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; skip last dc2tog; change color—8 repeats.
Rounds 10-13: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; change color.
Round 14 (Increase for forearm): Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; work (dc, ch 1, dc) in space before joining; change color—9 repeats.
Rounds 15-17: Ch 4, dc in same space, *(dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; change color.
Rounds 18-21: Repeat Rounds 14-17—10 repeats. Fasten off yarn; weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 1 ball 1931 Purple Haze
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: To fit Palm size: 8” (9”), (20.5 [23] cm); Finished Widest Circumference: 8” (9.25”), (20 [23.5] cm); Finished Length: 8.5” (9”), (21.5 [23] cm)
gauge: 14 sts and 13 rows in pattern = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
WRISTERS (make 2)
Leaving a 10” (25 cm) beginning tail, ch 31 (33).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *dc in next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across to last ch, dc in last ch, turn—15 (16) sc; 15 (16) dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, *dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across to last st, dc in last st, turn.
Rows 3-24 (3-28): Repeat Row 2.
Row 25 (29): Ch 1, sc in first st, *dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across to within last 13 (15) sts, dc in next st, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked—9 sc; 9 dc.
Row 26 (30): Repeat Row 2 on 18 sts. Fasten off, leaving a 14” (35.5 cm) tail.
FINISHING
With right sides together and using beginning tail, whipstitch the top of Row 24 (28) to the bottom of Row 1 for 10 (12) sts, then using the ending tail, whipstitch the top of Row 26 (30) to the bottom of Row 1.
NOTE
Should have 2 un-sewn sts on top of Row 24 [28] and bottom of Row 1 for thumb opening between the sewn sections. Weave in ends.
NOTE
For maximum stretch, weave in tails along seams.
Notes
1. For whip stitching, thread yarn through eye of yarn needle then sew by inserting needle under 2 loops at top of st, and 1 loop at bottom of indicated row.
2. Finished fabric is stretchy in width and length, just smooth over hand and wrist to adjust fit.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast G Minty (0520) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast H Persimmon (0220) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast C Tea Leaf (0624) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast D Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast E Blue (0886) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast F Pale Plum (0579) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast A Gold (0321) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast B Pretty n’ Pink (0722) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
measurements: One size to fit average Adult hand, approx 7½" [19 cm] around.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Note:
Version 1 2 3 4
Color 1 A C E G
Color 2 B D F H
MITTEN (make 2 in colors of choice)
With Color 1, ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 27 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 27 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 26 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Turn. Leave rem 6 sts unworked.
6th row: Ch 13. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 32 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 33 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 34 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Turn. 34 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 26 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. Join Color 2. Break Color 1.
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
11th to 14th rows: With Color 2, rep 9th and 10th rows twice more.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 33 sts.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 32 sts.
17th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. Leave rem st unworked. 30 sts.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. PM in sc just made. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 30 sc.
19th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sc.
20th row: Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 32 sc.
21st row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 33 sc.
22nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 34 sc.
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Turn. 34 sc.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 26 sc. 1 scbl in each of last 8 sc. Turn. 34 sc.
25th and 26th rows: Rep 23rd and 24th rows once more. At end of 26th row. Join Color 1. break Color 2.
27th row: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 8 sc. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Turn. 34 sc.
28th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 15 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
29th row: Ch 7. 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 21 sts.
30th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 19 sc. Turn. 20 sts.
31st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 19 sts.
32nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Notes:
• Right Hand Mitten fold WS tog.
• Left Hand Mitten fold RS tog.
Fold work in half, so that color change aligns at top of Mitten on front and back, then fold first 4 rows (first Thumb section) inwards, and fold last 4 rows (second Thumb section) upwards, so Thumb sections align, as shown in Assembly Diagram on page 3.
Join Color 1 with sl st to side of marked st.
1st row: (RS). Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. Working into side edges of rows, work sc evenly across top of Mitten. Working into tops of sts and rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Working into tops of sts, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Working into side edges of rows, work sc evenly across top of Thumb. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Working into tops of sts and rem loops of foundation ch, sl st in each st to last 8 sts. 1 sc in each of last 8 sts.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 722 Pretty ‘n Pink A and 528 Medium Purple B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: 8" circumference x 6½" long (20.5 x 16.5 cm)
gauge: 8 pattern repeats = 4" (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one double crochet and one chain space); 10 rows = 6" (15 cm)
instructions:
MITT (make 2)
Leaving a long tail for sewing, with B, ch 34.
Row 1: Dc in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch count as skipped ch, first dc, ch 1), *ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—16 dc and 15 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last dc, ch 1, skip last dc, dc in beginning ch-5 space, dc in 4th ch of beginning ch, turn—17 dc and 14 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1 here and throughout), skip next dc, dc in first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat in top of beginning ch-5, turn—16 dc and 15 ch-1 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across to last dc, ch 1, skip last dc, dc in beginning ch-4 space, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—17 dc and 14 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 5–10: Repeat last 2 rows 3 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING MITT
Fold mitt in half lengthwise. With beginning tail, sew edges together from bottom up until 3" (7.5 cm) remain, secure tail; with ending tail, sew sides together from top down 1" (2.5 cm) leaving 2" (5 cm) opening for thumb, secure tail.
FLOWER (make 2)
With B, ch 4; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 9 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc), working in front loops only, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next st, *(ch 2, slip st, ch 2, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * 3 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc, 4 slip sts, 9 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, slip st in same st as join, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—68 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, working in front loops only, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next st, *(ch 2, slip st, ch 2, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew flower to back of each mitt. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Fpsc: (front post single crochet) Insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Skip st behind the Fpsc.

Fpdc: (front post double crochet) Yarn over, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip st behind the Fpdc.
measurements: Wristers measure 7" [18 cm] circumference x 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 10 hdc = 4" [10 cm]; 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in half double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WRISTERS (make 2)
Ch 22, slip st in first ch to join, taking care not to twist sts.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around, slip st in first sc – 22 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, hdc in each st around, slip st in first hdc – 22 hdc.
Rounds 3-7: Ch 1, turn, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in first hdc.
Shape Thumbhole
Round 8: Ch 1, turn, hdc in first hdc, ch 4, skip 3 sts, hdc in next 18 hdc – 19 hdc and 4 ch.
Round 9: Ch 1, turn, hdc in next 18 hdc, hdc in each of next 4 ch, hdc in last hdc, slip st in first hdc – 23 hdc.
Rounds 10-13: Ch 1, turn, hdc in each hdc around, slip st in first hdc – 23 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, Fpdc in next st, [sc in next st, Fpdc in next st] 10 times, slip st in first st – 22 sts.
Round 15: Ch 1, [sc in next st, Fpdc in next st] 11 times, slip st in first st – 22 sts.
Round 16: Ch 1, Fpsc in each st around, slip st in first st. Fasten off.
Thumb
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn in first of skipped hdc of Round 8, ch 1, hdc in each of 3 skipped hdc, 2 hdc in side of hdc from Round 8, rotate work and hdc in each of 4 ch from Round 8, 2 hdc in side of next hdc from Round 8, slip st in first hdc – 11 sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar n' Cream® Scrub Off ™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Spring Blue (90016) 1 Ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit adult.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 33 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 6 times more.
Shape thumb gusset: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th and 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 17 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 14 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st or ch-1 sp to end of row. 33 sts.
Cont even until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm] ending with a WS row.
Shape top: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last st. Fasten off.
Sew side seam.
Thumb: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to ch sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 4 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 4 sts. Fasten off. Thread end through a tapestry needle and draw yarn through rem sts. Fasten securely.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. I/9 [5.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Puff st = (Yoh and draw up a long loop) 3 times in indicated stitch. 7 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch – puff st made.
measurements: To fit Child 3/5 yrs (Adult). To fit hand circumference: 6 (7.5)" [15 (19) cm]
gauge: 8 puff sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY 

Cuffs are worked in rows. Rem portion of Gloves are worked in rnds. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Carry color not in use loosely up WS of work. Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.

GLOVES (make 2 alike)

Cuff: With B, ch 7 (9).
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 (7) hdc.

2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Turn
Rep last row 10 (14) times more. With RS facing each other, fold first and last rows tog. Ch 1. Work sl sts through both thicknesses across to join cuff in rnd. Do not fasten off. Cont in rnds as follows:

Body of Glove: 1st rnd: With B, ch 1. Work 24 (30) sc evenly around side edge of Cuff. Join A with sl st to first sc. Do not break B. 

2nd rnd: With A, ch 3. (Puff st in next sc. Skip next sc) 12 (15) times. Join B with sl st to top of first puff st. 12 (15) puff sts.

3rd rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 sp). (Puff st between next 2 puff sts) 12 (15) times. Join A with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-4.

4th rnd: With A, ch 3. Puff st between dc and first puff st. (Puff st between next 2 puff sts) 11 (14) times. Join B with sl st to top of first puff st.

Rep last 2 rnds 1 (2) time(s) more.

Next rnd: (Thumb rnd) With B, ch 5 (counts as dc and ch-2 sp). Skip first 2 puff sts. (Puff st between next 2 puff sts) 10 (13) times. Join A with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-5.

Next rnd: With A, sl st into ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in ch-2 sp. 1 dc in top of next puff st. (1 dc between next 2 puff sts. 1 dc in top of next puff st) 10 (13) times. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Country Blue (9710) 1 ball
Contrast A Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult palm 7½" [19 cm].
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Mittens are worked from side to side.
RIGHT MITTEN
**With MC, ch 46 loosely.
Body of Mitten
1st row: (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to last 6 ch. 1 sc in each of last 6 ch. Turn. 44 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work (see diagram), 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 5 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
4th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 3 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
6th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loop only, 1 sc in next sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 3 times. Turn. 44 sts.**
Rep 2nd to 7th rows twice more.
***Thumb opening: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work (see diagram above), 1 hdc in each of next 20 hdc. Turn. Leave rem 18 sts unworked.
Cont working on upper part of Mitten (above Thumb opening):
2nd row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 5 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last 3 sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
5th row: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in next sc. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 3 times. Turn. 26 sts. Do not break yarn. Pull long loop to secure crochet sts.
Thumb opening (continued):
Work on lower part of Mitten (below Thumb opening) as follows:
1st row: (RS). Join MC with sl st to first unworked hdc. Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 18 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. Work in horizontal bar only, created by hdc, at front of work, 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more, ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Reinsert hook into pulled long loop of upper part of Mitten.***
Work 2nd to 7th rows as given for Body of Mitten across all 44 sts once more. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
****Thumb: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to right side of Thumb opening. Ch 1. Work 14 sc around edges of Thumb opening. Join with sl st to first sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Thumb measures 2" [5 cm].
Next rnd: (Sc2tog) 7 times. Join with sl st to first st. 7 sts.
Next rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Thread yarn through rem 4 sts. Gather tightly and fasten securely.****
LEFT MITTEN
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Mitten.
Rep 2nd to 7th rows once more.
Work from *** to *** as given for Right Mitten.
Work 2nd to 7th rows as given for Body of Right Mitten twice more.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Work from **** to **** as given for Right Mitten.
FINISHING
Sew side seams.
Pompoms: (Make 4). Wind 1 strand each of A and B around 2 fingers 35 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to cord. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape.
Cord: (Make 2). With B, make chain 15" [38 cm] long.
1st row: Sl st in back bump of 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Thread cord through sts as shown in picture, approx 2" [5 cm] above bottom edge of Mitten, beg and ending at outer side edge of Mitten. Pull gently to gather fabric around wrist, allowing room to remove Mitten. Tie ends in a bow. Sew pompom to each end of cord.

When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. RIGHT MITTEN **Cuff: With MC, ch 6 (6-7). 1st row: (RS). Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch across. Turn. 5 (5-6) sts. 2nd row: Working in back loops only , 1 sl st in each of next 5 (5-6) sl st . Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 4 (5-7) [10 (12.5-18) cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. Join side seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not fasten off. Turn work and proceed in rnds as follows: Mitten: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Shape thumb gusset: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 (7-9) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 (16-20) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 (7-9) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 (18-22) sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 (7-9) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 (20-24) sc. Size Adult only: 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sc. All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 (8-10) sc. Ch 1. Place marker on ch. Skip next 6 (6-8) sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 (8-10) sc. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 13 (15-19) sc. ***Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work after Cuff measures 3½ (4½-6) [9 (11.5-15) cm]. Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6-8) sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. 12 (14-18) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-5) sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3-5) sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 8 (10-14) sts. Sizes 6/8 yrs and Adult only: 3rd rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next (1-3) sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next (1-3) sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. (6-10) sts. Size Adult only: 4th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts. All sizes: Fasten off MC. MATERIALS Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Sizes 2/4 yrs 6/8 yrs Adult Main Color (MC) Pumpkin (28630) Contrast A Black (28040) Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. BRC0115-006173M SKILL LEVEL: EASY | CROCHET Next rnd: Join A with sl st to any st. Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 (3-3) times. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 (16-20) sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 (5-7) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 (18-22) sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 (5-7) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6-8) sc. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 13 (15-19) sc. materials: Yarn: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
Size S M L - 1 ball each for different sizes
Tools: Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements:
Sizes S M L XL
Finished Upper Arm Circumference: 9½ [24 cm], 10" [25.5 cm], 10½" [26.5 cm], 12" [30.5 cm] 
Finished Length: 14½" [37 cm], 15½" [39.5 cm], 16½" [42 cm], 18" [46 cm]
gauge: 12 double crochet (dc) and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
ARM WARMER (Make 2 alike)
Bottom Ribbing: Ch 7 (8 - 9 - 10 ).
1st row:  1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 (7 - 8 - 9 ) sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 18th (22nd - 24th - 26th ) rows: Rep 2nd row. Do not fasten off.
Arm: 1st row:  Turn work sideways. Ch 1. Work 18 (22 - 24 - 26 ) sc evenly along side of Bottom Ribbing. Turn.
Note:  Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as 1 double crochet (dc).
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (same sp as first ch-3). 1 dc in each dc to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 20 (24 - 26 - 28 ) dc.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 4 (3 - 3 - 4 ) times more. 28 (30 - 32 - 36 ) dc.
Rep 2nd row until work measures 13 (13½ - 14 - 15 )" [ 33 (34 - 35.5 - 38 ) cm] from lower edge of Bottom Ribbing, ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Top Ribbing 1st row:  (RS). Ch 7 (8 - 9 - 10 ). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Slip stitch (sl st) in first st of Arm. Do not turn. 6 (7 - 8 - 9 ) sc.
2nd row:  Sl st in next st of Arm. Turn. Ch 1. Skip last sl st. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc (across Top Ribbing) to end of row. Turn.
3rd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc (across Top Ribbing) to end of row. Sl st in next st of Arm. Do not turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows across entire top of Arm, ending with a RS row.
Fasten off, leaving a 20" [51 cm] tail for seam.
FINISHING
With yarn tail, sew side edges of Arm Warmer tog, leaving a 1" [2.5 cm] thumb opening at wrist (above Bottom Ribbing). Weave in ends.
Note: Yarn is worked as ‘self-striping’ yarn, allowing colors to change as they appear.
Note: Top Ribbing is joined to top edge on every row of Arm edge by working sts of ribbing, then working a slip st in next st of Arm.

materials: 1 Ball Stitch Nation by Debbie Stoller™ 'Washable Ewe™' 3525 Dragonfly
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: One mitt measures 8” long x 8” around palm.
gauge: 3½ pattern repeats = 4”; 8 rounds = 4” in pattern. Note: One pattern repeat consists of 3 dc and one ch-1. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Hand warmers are worked in joined rounds, with right side always facing you. Join at the end of each round, but do not turn.
MITT (Make 2)
Ch 42; taking care not to twist ch; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Lower Edge): [Skip next 2 ch, 5 hdc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch] 7 times; join with slip st in first hdc—Seven 5-hdc groups.
Round 2 (Right Side): Flip work over and work in bottom of foundation ch, slip st in each ch to ch at base of first 5-hdc group, ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in same ch (at base of first 5-hdc group), [ch 1, 3 dc in ch at base of next 5-hdc group] 6 times, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Seven 3-dc groups.
Round 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), [3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 1] 6 times, 2 dc in last ch-1 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4.
Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first ch-1 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 6 times, ch 1; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Rounds 5 and 6: Repeat Rounds 3 and 4.
Round 7: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), [3 dc in next ch-1 space, ch 2] 6 times, 2 dc in last ch-1 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5.
Round 8: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space] 6 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 9: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), [3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 6 times, 2 dc in last ch-2 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5.
Rounds 10 and 11: Repeat Rounds 8 and 9.
Round 12: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space] 5 times, ch 2, dc in last ch-2 space, do not join.
Round 13 (Thumb Opening): Ch 8 (for thumb opening), dc in top of beginning ch-3 of Round 12, [ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space] 5 times, ch 2, 2 dc in next ch-2 space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of ch-8.
Round 14: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in same ch-8 space, [ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space] 6 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 15: Ch 1, 5 hdc in next dc (center dc of 3-dc group), sc in next ch-2 space, [5 hdc in center dc of next 3-dc group, sc in next ch-2 space] 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
  Stitch Nation by Debbie Stoller™ “Washable Ewe™” Art. T103 available in 3.5 oz (100 g),  183 yd (167 m) balls.

materials: Patons® Alpaca Blend™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 155 yds/142 m) Contrast A Sable (01004) 1 ball
Patons® Shetland Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 143 yds/131 m) Contrast D White (78006) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) and U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
Sc2togspl = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc between ‘legs’ of stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One size to fit Adult palm 7½" [19 cm]
gauge: 11 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook in pat.
instructions: Notes: When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use. Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. RIGHT MITTEN **Cuff: With A and smaller hook, ch 10. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, from beg measures 7½" [19 cm]. Do not fasten off. Change to larger hook and proceed as follows: Set-up rnd: Ch 1. Work 24 sc across longer side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd. Beg working Chart I, reading rnds from right to left. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 splsc in each st around. Rep last rnd, and cont working Chart until 10th rnd of Chart is complete. ** Thumb opening: Next rnd: Pat across 12 sts. Ch 5. Skip next 5 sts. Pat to end of rnd. Next rnd: Pat across 12 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Pat to end of rnd. *** Cont working chart to end of chart, noting decreases on 29th to 32nd rnds of chart. 4 sts rem. Fasten off leaving a long end. Fold Mitten flat. Sew top seam with yarn end. Thumb: Join A with sl st to first skipped sc of Thumb opening. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Working in rem loops of ch 5, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Join. 10 sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 splsc in each sc around. Rep last rnd until Thumb measures 2½" [6.5 cm]. Next rnd: (Sc2togspl) 5 times. 5 sts. Join. Fasten off. Thread end through rem 5 sts. Gather tightly and fasten securely. *** LEFT MITTEN Work from ** to ** as given for Right Mitten, working Chart II in place of Chart I. Thumb opening: Next rnd: Pat across 7 sts. Ch 5. Skip next 5 sts. Pat to end of rnd. Next rnd: Pat across 7 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Pat to end of rnd. Work from *** to *** as given for Right Mitten.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”: 1 ball each 4614 Black A and 4600 White B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Sleeve Length = 26”
gauge: 11 sts = 4”; 4 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SLEEVE
Leaving an 18” yarn tail with A, ch 42 (48); join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring taking care that ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each ch around; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 42 (48) sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, [ch 3, skip next 3 dc, dc in next 3 dc] 6 (7) times, ch 3; join in top of ch-3.
Rounds 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, and 17: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch-3 space), skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, skip next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 6 (7) times, ch 3, 2 dc in last ch-3 space; join in 3rd ch of ch-6.
Rounds 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, and 16: Ch 3, 2 dc in ch-3 space, [ch 3, skip next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 6 (7) times, ch 3; join.
Round 18: Ch 3, 2 dc in next space, [dc in next 3 dc, 3 dc in next space] 6 (7) times, dc in last 3 dc; join.
Round 19: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join.
Straps: Ch 245, slip st in next 22 (25) dc, ch 245, slip st in next dc. Fasten off.
FLOWER MOTIF
With A, ch 6; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 16 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch-3 space), skip first 2 sc, [dc in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc] 7 times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
Round 3: Ch 1, [(sc, hdc, 5 dc, hdc, sc) all in ch-3 space] 8 times; join in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: Join B between 2 sc, ch 1, sc in same place as joining, ch 6, [sc between next 2 sc, ch 6] 7 times; join.
Round 5: Ch 1, [(sc, hdc, 6 dc, hdc, sc) in ch-6 space] 8 times; join.
Round 6: Slip st in next 5 sts, [ch 7, skip next 9 sts, slip st in next st (6th st of petal)] 7 times, ch 7; join in 6th slip st.
Round 7: Ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in same st as joining, 6 dc in ch-7 space, [(2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) all in next slip st, 6 dc in ch-7 space] 7 times; join in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Finishing
With 18” yarn tail of A, sew motif across lower edge of sleeve from first ch-2 space across next 20 sts to 3rd ch-2 space. Fasten off.
Join B in next ch-2 space, [slip st in next 10 dc, slip st in next space] 4 times; join with a slip st in first slip st, forming cuff of sleeve. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast B Light Country Blue (9709) 1 ball
Contrast D Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Set of 4 size U.S. 6 (4 mm) double-pointed knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: K1below = Knit into next stitch 1 row below at the same time slipping off stitch above
M1 = Make 1 stitch by picking up horizontal loop lying before next stitch and knitting into back of loop
P1below = Purl into next stitch 1 row below at the same time slipping off stitch above
measurements: To fit Adult palm 7½ ( 8½)" [19 (21.5) cm]
gauge: 20 sts and 26 rows = 4" [10 cm] in stocking st.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
RIGHT MITTEN 
**With set of double-pointed needles and A, cast on 30 (36) sts. Divide onto 3 needles 10 (12) sts on each needle. PM for beg of rnd. 
1st rnd: Knit.
2nd rnd: *K1. P1below. Rep from * around.
Rep these 2 rnds for Shaker Rib Pat for 3" [7.5 cm]. Break A. 
Next rnd: With D, [K5 (6). M1] 6 times. 36 (42) sts.
With D, proceed in Seed St Pat as follows:
1st rnd: *K1. P1. Rep from * around. 
2nd rnd: *P1. K1. Rep from * around. 
Rep last 2 rnds of Seed St Pat for 2½" [6.5 cm]. Break D.**
Shape thumb opening: 1st rnd:
With B, K18 (21). Slip next 8 sts onto a st holder. Cast on 7 (9) sts. Knit to end of rnd. 35 (43) sts.
***With B, proceed in Mistake Rib Pat as follows: 
1st rnd: *K2. P2. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K2. P1.
2nd rnd: P1. K2. *P2. K2. Rep from * around. 
Rep last 2 rnds of Mistake Rib Pat for 2½" [6.5 cm], ending on a RS row and inc (dec) 1 st at end of last rnd. 36 (42) sts. Break B.
With C, proceed in Textured Pat as follows: 
1st rnd: Knit. 
2nd rnd: Purl. 
3rd and 4th rnds: *K1. P1. Rep from * around.
Rep 4 last rnds of Textured Pat until work after ribbing measures 6 (6½)" [15 (16.5) cm], ending on a 4th rnd.
Shape top: Keeping cont of Textured Pat, proceed as follows:
1st rnd: *K4 (5). K2tog. Rep from * around. 30 (36) sts.
2nd rnd: Purl.
3rd and 4th rnds: *K1. P1. Rep from * around.
5th rnd: *K3 (4). K2tog. Rep from * around. 24 (30) sts.
6th to 8th rnds: As 2nd to 4th rnds.
9th rnd: *K2 (3). K2tog. Rep from * around. 18 (24) sts.
10th to 12th rnds: As 2nd to 4th rnds.
13th rnd: *K1 (2). K2tog. Rep from * around. 12 (18) sts.
Larger size only: 14th to 16th rnds: As 2nd to 4th rnds.
17th rnd: *K1. K2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
Both sizes: Break yarn leaving a long end. Thread end through rem 12 sts. Draw up and fasten securely.
Thumb: With B, K8 from st holder. Pick up and knit 8 sts at base of thumb. Divide these 16 sts onto 3 needles (5, 5, 6). Join in rnd. Knit 9 rnds even. 
Next rnd: (K2. K2tog) 4 times. 12 sts. 
Next rnd: (K2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. 
Break yarn leaving a long end. Thread end through rem 6 sts. 
Draw up and fasten securely.*** 
LEFT MITTEN 
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Mitten.
Shape thumb opening: 1st rnd:
With B, K10 (13). Slip next 8 sts onto a st holder. Cast on 8 sts. Knit to end of rnd. 36 (42) sts.
Work from *** to *** as given for Right Mitten.

materials: Red Heart® Super Easy™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 238 yds/218 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook
or size needed to obtain gauge. Susan Bates® stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit adult palm: M (L): 7½ (8½)" [19 (21.5) cm].
gauge: 9 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for M. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written M (L). When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.

MITTENS

LEFT MITTEN
**With A, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sl sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each sl st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, when slightly stretched, from beg measures 7½ (8½ )" [19 (21.5 ) cm].
Join seam: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Fasten off A. Turn work and proceed as follows:
Set-up rnd: Join MC with sl st to side seam. Ch 1. Work 18 (20 ) sc across longer side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 1st rnd 2 (3 ) times more, then proceed as follows:**
Shape thumb gusset: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 (9 ) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 19 (21 ) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 (9 ) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 21 (23 ) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 (9 ) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join 23 (25 ) sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 (9 ) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join 25 (27 ) sc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 (9 ) sc. Ch 1. Skip next 8 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 (9 ) sc. 1 sc in next ch. PM. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 19 (21 ) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work after Cuff measures 5½ (6½ )" [ 14 (16.5 ) cm].

***Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 18 (20 ) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 (6 ) sc. Sc2tog] twice. Join. 14 (16 ) sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 (4 ) sc. Sc2tog] twice. Join. 10 (12 ) sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. [Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 1 (2 ) sc. Sc2tog] twice. Join. 6 (8 ) sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Fold top flat. Sew top seam using Whipstitch. Fasten securely.

WHIPSTITCH
Thumb: Join MC with sl st at marker. Ch 1. 1 sc in rem loop of ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join. 9 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until Thumb from marker measures 1¾ (2 )" [ 4.5 (5 ) cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 5 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.**

RIGHT MITTEN
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Mitten.
Shape thumb gusset: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 (10 ) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 19 (21 ) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 (10 ) sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 21 (23 ) sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 (10 ) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join 23 (25 ) sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 (10 ) sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join 25 (27 ) sc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 (10 ) sc. Ch 1. Skip next 8 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 (10 ) sc. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 19 (21 ) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work after Cuff measures 5½ (6½ )" [ 14 (16.5 ) cm].

Work from *** to *** as given for Left Mitten.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1252 Mango
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Wristers measure 7½” (19cm) circumference x 8¼” (21cm) long
gauge: 12 sc = 4” (10cm); 12 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Cuff
Ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across, ch 1, turn – 6 sc.
Rows 2-19: In back loops only, sc in each sc, ch 1, turn.
Row 20: In both loops, sc in each sc, ch 1, do not turn.
Note: From this point forward, work progresses in rounds.
Hand
Round 1: Work 20 sc evenly along long end of piece, join with slip st, ch 1 – 20 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Round 3: In back loops only, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Round 4: In both loops, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Round 5: In back loops only, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Rounds 6-8: In both loops, sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc, ch 1.
Round 9: In back loops only, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Round 10: In both loops, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Row 11: In back loops only, sc in each sc, do not join, ch 1, turn (thumb opening).
Rows 12-14: In both loops, sc in each sc, do not join, ch 1, turn.
Row 15: In back loops only, sc in each sc, do not join, ch 1, turn.
Round 16: In both loops, sc in each sc around, ch 2, join with slip st to first sc, ch 1, turn (thumb opening complete).
Round 17: 2 sc in ch-2 space, in back loops only, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1 – 22 sc.
Round 18: In both loops, sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Rounds 19-20: Sc in each sc around, join with slip st, ch 1.
Round 21: Crab st in each sc around, join with slip st. Fasten off.
Thumb:
Next Round: Work 17 sc evenly spaced around thumb opening starting at the base of the thumb, join with slip st, fasten off.
Weave in ends. Sew ends of cuff closed.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 skein 936 Gold/Black.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
fpdc (front post double crochet) = yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front around the post of indicated stitch and draw yarn through, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice.
measurements: One size fits most: 8” [20 cm] long X 8” [20 cm] around.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 14 rounds = 4” [10 cm] in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WRISTERS (Make 2)
Ribbing
Ch 24; join with a slip st in first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist the chain.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in next ch and each ch around; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 24 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, * fpdc around next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * to last st; fpdc around last st; join.
Repeat Round 2 until 2” [5 cm] from beginning.
Hand
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Next Round: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Repeat last round until 7” [18 cm] from beginning.
Thumb Opening: Ch 1, sc in each sc around to last 4 sc, ch 4, skip last 4 sc; join.
Next Round: Ch 2, skip first sc, hdc in each sc and ch around; join – 24 sts.
Repeat last round until 8” [20 cm] from beginning. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: YARN: Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
COLORS: Cyber Leaf (2021), 1 ball (4 Granny Squares) or 168 yds/154 m
TOOLS: Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] long x 8" [20.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
NOTES
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• Each color aligns with 1 round (rnd) in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some stitches (sts) and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
