abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in next st twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Length 6 1/2"/16.5 cm Circumference (around hand) 6"/15 cm
gauge: In single crochet, 13 sts and 18 rows = 4"/10cm.
instructions:
NOTES 1. Mittens are worked from striped cuff upwards. 2. Mittens are worked back and forth in rows then seamed. 3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Do not fasten off old color. Carry colors not in use across wrong side of piece until next needed.
MITTEN (make 2)
With A, ch 21. Row 1 (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn; change to B in last sc. Rows 3 and 4: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn; change to C in last sc of Row 4. Rows 5 and 6: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn; change to A in last sc of Row 6. Row 7: With A, ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across, 2 sc in last sc, turn—22 sc.
Shape for Thumb Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last 10 sc, turn—24 sc. Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 10 sc, turn—26 sc. Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 10 sc, turn—28 sc.
Divide for Hand and Thumb Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc, sk next 8 sc (for thumb), sc in next 10 sc, turn—20 sc. Row 12: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Repeat last row until hand measures 4 1/2"/11.5cm, measured from last C-colored row.
Top of Hand Next Row: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next sc; repeat from * across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—13 sc. Next Row: Ch 1, *sc2tog; repeat from * across to last st, sc in last st, turn—7 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for gathering top and sewing mitten seam.
Thumb Row 1: With RS facing, join A with sc in first of the 8 skipped thumb sts, sc in next 7 skipped thumb sts, turn—8 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Repeat last row until thumb measures 1 1/4"/3cm, measured from Row 1 of thumb.
Next Row: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 4 times—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for gathering top and sewing thumb seam.
Cord (make 1) With A, ch 100. Fasten off.
FINISHING Using yarn needle, thread tail at top of thumb through stitches of last row and pull gently to gather. With tail, sew sides of thumb together. Using yarn needle, thread tail at top of hand through stitches of last row and pull gently together. With tail, sew sides of mitten together. Sew each end of cord to one mitten. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Turqua (0512) 1 ball

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: To fit adult palm 7½" [19 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
MITTENS
RIGHT MITTEN 
Cuff:  **Ch 12. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 11 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Cuff, when slightly stretched, measures 7½" [19 cm].** Do not fasten off.
CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: INTERMEDIATE
MATERIALS
Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) 
Turqua (0512) 1 ball
Note: 1 ball makes 2 pairs of Mittens.
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. 
Stitch marker. Yarn needle.

Proceed in pat as follows: 
See Diagram on page 3.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Work 33 sc across longer side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd.** 
2nd rnd: Ch 3.  Draw up a loop in each of the following sps: 2nd and 3rd loops from hook, same sc as last sl st and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook  – beg Star Cluster made. Ch 1. * Draw up a loop in each of following sps: top of prev Star Cluster, under 2 vertical strands of last st of prev Star Cluster, in same sp as last loop drawn up of prev Star Cluster and each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 6 loops on hook  – Star Cluster made. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch 3. 16 Star Clusters.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 33 sc.
Rep last 2 rnds for pat until work after Cuff measures 2½" [6.5 cm], ending on 2nd rnd.**
Thumb opening: Keeping cont of pat, proceed as follows: 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. (1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 8 times. Ch 7. Skip next: [(Star Cluster. Ch-1 sp) 3 times, Star Cluster]. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. Rep from * to end of rnd, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 3. Beg Star Cluster. Ch 1. *Star Cluster over same sp as last loop drawn up of prev Star Cluster and each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around, working in each ch of ch-7 sp. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch 3. 16 Star Clusters.
Cont even in pat until work after Cuff measures 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on 2nd rnd.
***Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 sts.
2nd and alt rnds:  Ch 3. Beg Star Cluster. Ch 1. *Star Cluster. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch-3.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 19 sts.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 13 sts. Fasten off. 
Fold Mitten flat. Sew rem sts tog. 
Thumb: Join yarn with sl st to first skipped sc of Thumb opening. 
Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Working in rem loops of ch 7, 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until Thumb measures 2" [5 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 7 times. Join with sl st to first st. 7 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. 
Thread yarn through rem 4 sts. Gather tightly and fasten securely.*** 
LEFT MITTEN 
Work from ** to ** as given for Right Mitten. 
Thumb opening: Keeping cont of pat, proceed as follows: 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. (1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 7. Skip next: [(Star Cluster. Ch-1 sp) 3 times, Star Cluster]. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in top of next Star Cluster. Rep from * to end of rnd, ending with 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 3. Beg Star Cluster. Ch 1. *Star Cluster over same sp as last loop drawn up of prev Star Cluster and each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around, working in each ch of ch-7 sp. Join with sl st to 2nd ch of beg ch 3. 16 Star Clusters.
Cont even in pat until work after Cuff measures 6½" [16.5 cm], ending on 2nd rnd.
Work from *** to *** as given for Right Mitten. 
FINISHING
Sew sides of Ribbing.

materials: One size US H-8 (5mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6"/18cm circumference (at wrist) x 5"/12.5cm long, unstretched. Note: Gloves stretch to fit a range of sizes.
gauge: In hdc, 20 sts and 13 rows = 4"/10cm
instructions: WRISTLETS (make 2) Ch 30; taking care not to twist ch, join with sl st in first ch to form a ring. Rnd 1: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each ch around; join with sl st in top of beg ch—30 hdc. Rnds 2–5: Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc around; join with sl st in top of beg ch. Note: Work now proceeds in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnds. Place a marker in first ch-3 sp to indicate beg of rnd and move marker up as each rnd is completed. Rnd 6: Ch 3, *sk next hdc, sc in next hdc, ch 3; rep from * around; do not join, sl st in first 2 ch of first ch-3 sp. Rnds 7–12: *Ch 3, sc in next ch-3 sp; rep from * around. Thumb Opening: Rnd 13: [Ch 3, sc in next ch-3 sp] twice, ch 4 (for thumb opening), sk next 3 ch-3 sp, *sc in next ch-3 sp, ch 3; rep from * all the way around to ch-4 sp (thumb opening), sc in first 2 ch of ch-4 sp, sl st in next ch. Rnds 14 and 15: Rep Rnd 7, ending last rnd at thumb opening. Fasten off. Finishing: Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1704 Bubblegum A, 1201 Daffodil B, and 1932 Minty C for Girl’s mittens
RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1909 Holly Berry A, 1505 Peacock B, and 1805 Bluebell C for Boy’s mittens
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Mitten measures 5 (6, 6½)" [12.5 (15, 16.5) cm] circumference of palm x 6½ (7½, 8)" [16.5 (19, 20.5) cm] long, including cuff.
gauge: 8 hdc = 2" (5 cm); 6 rows = 2" (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Cuff
With A, ch 11. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—10 sts. 
Row 2: Slip st in each sc across, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each slip st across, turn.
Rows 4–19 (4–23, 4–25): Repeat last 2 rows 8 (10, 11) times.
Row 20 (24, 26): With right sides held together and working through both thicknesses of first and last rows, slip st in each st across.
Palm
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, slip st in end of each row around; work invisible join in first slip st—20 (24, 26) slip sts.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B with slip st in first st, ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), hdc in each slip st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—20 (24, 26) hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Rounds 4–6 (4–7, 4–8): Repeat Round 3.
Thumb Opening 
Right Hand Round 7 (8, 9): Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc in next 2 sts, ch 5 (5, 6), skip next 5 (5, 6) sts, hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—15 (19, 20) hdc and 5 (5, 6) ch.
Left Hand Round 7 (8, 9): Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc in next 11 (15, 16) sts, ch 5 (5, 6), skip next 5 (5, 6) sts, hdc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—15 (19, 20) hdc and 5 (5, 6) ch.
Finger Cover
Round 8 (9, 10): Ch 2, working in back loops of sts and top loops of ch, hdc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—20 (24, 26) hdc.
Round 9 (10 and 11, 11–13): Repeat Round 3; change to C at end of last round. 
Rounds 10–13 (12–16, 14–19): Repeat Round 3.
Round 14 (17, 20): Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc2tog, *hdc in next st, hdc2tog; repeat from * 4 (6, 6) times, hdc in last 2 (0, 2) sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—14 (16, 18) hdc.
Rounds 15 and 16 (18 and 19, 21 and 22): Repeat Round 3.
Round 17 (20, 23): Ch 2, working in back loops only, [hdc2tog] around to last st, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 (9, 10) sts.
Round 18 (21, 24): Repeat Round 3. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through back loop of each st around; pull gently to close. Secure tail and weave in on wrong side.
Thumb
Round 1: With right side of Thumb Opening facing, join A with slip st in back loop of st near same edge as beginning of round for palm, ch 2, working in back loops of skipped sts of Round 6 (7, 8) and in back bars of ch of Round 7 (8, 9), hdc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 (10, 12) sts. 
Rounds 2–4 (2–5, 2–6): Repeat Round 3 of Palm.
Round 5 (6, 7): [Hdc2tog] around—5 (5, 6) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Weave tail through back loop of each st around; pull gently to close. Secure tail and weave in on wrong side.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama Halo™ Perfect Phasing™ (17.6 oz/500 g; 1059 yds/968 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: S/M Approx 14½" [37 cm] circumference x 16½" [42 cm] long. L/XL  Approx 18" [45.5 cm] circumference x 16½" [42 cm] long. Note: Legwarmers will stretch to fit.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Before starting Legwarmers, divide yarn into 5 sections of color to represent dominant shade changes (from center of ball outward).
• Beg with center section, label the 5 color sections – A, B, C, D, E to correspond to pattern references.
• Legwarmers are worked side to side.
The instructions are written for size S/M. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written S/M ( L/XL). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

LEGWARMER (make 2 alike)
With A (see Notes), ch 67 loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 60 ch. Turn. 66 sts.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working into horizontal loop lying below next st (see diagram), 1 hdc in each of next 60 hdc. Working into back loop only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working into back loop only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Working into horizontal loop lying below next st (see diagram), 1 hdc in each of next 60 hdc. Turn.
4th to 8th (10th) rows: Rep last 2 rows for pat 2 (3) times more, then 2nd row once. Break A.
Join B and work 8 (10) rows in established pat. Break B.
Join C and work 8 (10) rows in established pat. Break C.
Join D and work 8 (10) rows in established pat. Break D.
Join E and work 8 (10) rows in established pat. Do not fasten off.
Joining row: With WS tog, align last row and foundation row. Working through rem loops of foundation row tog with last row, sl st loosely in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Fair Isle™, Art. E300F available in 5 oz (141 g), 236 yds (215 m); skeins
gauge: 12 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
ARM WARMER (Make 2)
Bottom Ribbing
Ch 7 (8, 9, 10).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 6 (7, 8, 9) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each st across – 6 (7, 8, 9) sc.
Rows 3-18 (22, 24, 26): Repeat Row 2. Do not fasten off on last row worked.
Arm
Row 1: Ch 1, turn to work along one long side edge, sc in side of each sc row – 18 (22, 24, 26) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 20 (24, 26, 28) sc.
Repeat Rows 2-3 until there are 26 (28, 30, 32) sts on last row worked.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 13 (13½, 14, 15)" [33 (34, 35.5, 38) cm] from lower edge of Bottom Ribbing, end with wrong side row. Do not fasten off on last row worked.
Top Ribbing
Note: Top ribbing is joined to top edge of arm every row by working sts of ribbing and then working a slip st in next st of Arm.
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 7 (8, 9, 10), sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across, slip st in first sc of Arm – 6 (7, 8, 9) sc.
Row 2: Slip st in next sc of Arm, ch 1, turn, skip previous slip st, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across of Ribbing – 6 (7, 8, 9) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across Ribbing, slip st in next sc of Arm.
Repeat Rows 2-3 across entire top of Arm, end with right side row.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Sew seam, leaving a 1" [2.5 cm] opening at wrist for thumb, if desired. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® “Heart & Sole™”: 2 balls 3931 Berry Bliss.
Stitch markers, four ¼” buttons, yarn needle.
abbreviations: Fsc (foundation single crochet) = First St: Ch 2, insert hook under top 2 strands of first ch, yo, draw up a loop, yo, draw through 1 loop, yo, draw through both loops (first fsc complete). Remaining sts: Insert hook under both loops of previous st, yo, draw up a loop, yo, draw through 1 loop, yo, draw through both loops.
Esc (extended single crochet) = Insert hook into the next st, yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 1 loop, yo and draw through both loops.
Esc2tog (extended single crochet two together) = Insert hook under front loop only of next 2 sts, yo and draw a loop through both sts, yo and draw through 1 loop, yo and draw through both loops.

Fpsc (front post single crochet) = Insert hook from front to back and to front again around post of indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on your hook. Skip the stitch in the current row “behind” the Fpsc.

Bpsc (back post single crochet) = Insert hook from back side of work to front and to back again around the post of indicated stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on your hook. Skip the stitch “in front of” the Bpsc.
measurements: One size fits most.
gauge: 18 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GLOVE
Hand
Foundation round: Fsc 30, join in a round with slip st.
Round 1: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2
Round 2: Ch 2, fpsc in first st, bpsc in 2nd st, *fpsc in next st, bpsc in next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2.
Rounds 3 & 4: Repeat Round 2.
Round 5: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (30 sts).
Round 6: Ch 2, 2 esc in next st, esc in each st to last 2 sts, 2 esc in next st, esc in last st, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (32 sts).
Round 7: Repeat Round 5.
Round 8: Repeat Round 6 (34 sts).
Round 9: Repeat Round 5.
Round 10: Repeat Round 6 (36 sts).
Round 11: Repeat Round 5.
Round 12: Repeat Round 6 (38 sts).
Round 13: Repeat Round 5.
Round 14: Repeat Round 6 (40 sts).
Round 15: Repeat Round 5.
Round 16: Repeat Round 6 (42 sts).
Rounds 17 & 18: Repeat Round 5.
Round 19: Ch 2, esc in next 38 sts, esc into the post of the last esc made, place a marker in this st (counts as a ch-2) round complete.
Round 20: Skip the last 4 sts of the last round, esc into the 5th st of the round just finished (you just set aside sts for the thumb that will be worked later), esc in the next 33 sts, join the round with a slip st to the esc with the marker (34 sts).
Round 21: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (34 sts).
Rounds 22, 24, 26: Repeat Round 21.
Round 23: Ch 2, 2 esc in next st, esc in each st to last 2 sts, 2 esc in next st, esc in last st, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (36 sts).
Round 25: Ch 2, 2 esc in next st, esc in each st to last 2 sts, 2 esc in next st, esc in last st, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (38 sts).
Round 27: Ch 2, esc in next 15 sts, skip 8 sts, esc in last 15 sts, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (you just set aside the sts for the pinkie that will be worked later) (30 sts).
Round 28: Ch 2, esc in next 10 sts, skip 10 sts, esc in last 10 sts, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (you just set aside the sts for the ring finger that will be worked later) (20 sts).
Round 29: Ch 2, esc in next 5 sts, [esc into the post of the last st] twice, skip 10 sts, esc in last 5 sts, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (you just set aside the sts for the middle finger that will be worked later) (12 sts).
Index Finger
Round 30: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Rounds 31-37: Repeat Round 30.
FOR THE RIGHT HAND
Round 38: Ch 2, esc in next 6 sts, esc through the back loop only of next 6 sts (across back of hand), join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
FOR THE LEFT HAND  
Round 38: Ch 2, esc through the back loop only of next 6 sts (across back of hand), esc in next 6 sts, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
FOR BOTH HANDS
Round 39: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2, fasten off and weave in ends.
Fingertip
Round 1: Join yarn to front loop of the first esc that was worked through the back loop only in Round 38, ch 2 and esc through the same front loop, esc through the front loop only of the next 5 sts, [work esc in the post of the last st] 6 times, being careful not to twist, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Rounds 2, 3, 4: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Round 5: Ch 2, [esc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2, ch 4, slip st in joined st (this creates button loop). Fasten off, weave tail through the top of all sts and tighten to close, weave in ends.
Middle Finger
Round 1: Join yarn between 2 sts at the base of the index finger facing the middle finger, ch 2, esc in the 5th st of Round 28 (same as the base of the index finger), esc in next 10 sts, esc in the 15th st of Round 28 (again, same as the base of the index finger), join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Rounds 2-13: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Round 14: Ch 2, [esc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2. Fasten off, weave tail through the top of all sts and tighten to close, weave in ends.
Ring Finger
Round 1: Join yarn through the posts of both sts at the base of the middle finger, facing the ring finger, ch 2, esc in the 10th st of Round 27 (same as the base of the middle finger), esc in next 10 sts, esc in the 21st st of Round 27 (again, same as the base of the middle finger), join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Rounds 2-12: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Round 13: Ch 2, [esc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2. Fasten off, weave tail through the top of all sts and tighten to close, weave in ends.
Pinkie
Round 1: Join yarn through the posts of both sts at the base of the ring finger, facing the pinkie finger, ch 2, esc in the 15th st of Round 26 (same as the base of the ring finger), esc in next 8 sts, esc in the 24th st of Round 26 (again, same as the base of the ring finger), join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (10 sts).
Rounds 2-8: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (10 sts).
Round 9: Ch 2, [esc2tog] 5 times, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2. Fasten off, weave tail through the top of all sts and tighten to close, weave in ends.
Thumb
Round 1: This round of the thumb was begun in Round 20 of the hand (ch 2 and 4 esc already exist). Join yarn to the 5th st of Round 20, ch 2 (this counts as an esc), 2 esc in the 38th st of Round 19, esc in the next 3 sts, 2 esc in last st, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Rounds 2-6: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
FOR THE RIGHT HAND
Round 7: Ch 2, esc in next 6 sts, esc through the back loop only of next 6 sts, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
FOR THE LEFT HAND  
Round 7: Ch 2, esc through the back loop only of next 6 sts, esc in next 6 sts, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
FOR BOTH HANDS
Round 8: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2, fasten off and weave in ends.
Thumb Tip
Round 1: Join yarn to the front loop of the first esc that was worked through the back loop only in Round 7, ch 2 and esc through the same front loop, esc through the front loop only of the next 5 sts, [work esc in the post of the last st] 6 times, being careful not to twist, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Rounds 2-4: Ch 2, esc in each st around, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2 (12 sts).
Round 5: Ch 2, [esc2tog] 6 times, join with slip st to the 2nd ch of ch-2, ch 4, slip st in joined st (buttonhole made). Fasten off, weave tail through the top of all sts and tighten to close. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Lay the index finger and thumb tips back against hand and mark the st that lies underneath the buttonhole loop at the tip; sew buttons at these points.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 0226 Natural OR 419 Ecru.
Tapestry needle, 20 (22, 24) 6mm gray glass pearl beads, beading needle or needle that can go through bead holes and matching thread.
abbreviations: v-st = (dc, ch 1, dc) all in same st or space.
v-st over v-st = v-st in ch-1 space of next v-st.
beg cl (beginning cl) = ch 2, [yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] 4 times all in same space, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
cl (cluster) = [yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] 5 times all in same space, yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
measurements: Finished Measurements: 3½ (4, 4½)” across widest part of hand; 9½ (9½, 10)” long.
gauge: 14 V sts = 4”; 16 rows of V st = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Armlet (Make 2)
Hand
Ch 60 (66, 72); join with slip st in first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist ch.
Round 1: (Ch 4, dc) in same ch as joining (counts as beginning v-st), skip next 2 ch, [v-st in next ch, skip next 2 ch] 19 (21, 23) times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 20 (22, 24) v-sts.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) all in first space, [v-st over v-st] 19 (21, 23) times; join.
Rounds 3-8 (3-8, 3-9): Repeat Round 2.
Thumb Shaping
Now work in rows:
Row 1: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first space, [v-st over v-st] 19 (21, 23) times; do NOT join; TURN.
Rows 2-5 (2-4, 2-4): (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first space, [v-st over v-st] 19 (21, 23) times; turn.
Rows 6-8 (5-8, 5-9): (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first space, [ ch 1, v-st over v-st] 19 (21, 23) times; turn. At end of Row 8 (8, 9), join in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Arm Length
Now work in rounds (turn if necessary to work on right side):
Round 1: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first space, [v-st over v-st skipping over ch-1 spaces] 19 (21, 23) times; join.
Repeat Round 2 until it gets too snug on your arm, then add a ch between V sts as often as needed until armlet measures 9 (9, 10)” long or preferred length. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Round 1: (Slip st, beg cl) in first space, ch 1, cl in ch-1 space of next v-st, ch 5, [cl in ch-1 space of next v-st, ch 1, cl in ch-1 space of next v-st, ch 5] 9 (10, 11) times; join in top of first cl – 20 (22, 24) cl.
Round 2: Ch 3, (3 tr, ch 3, slip st) all in first cl, (slip st, ch 3, 3 tr, ch 3, slip st) all in ch-1 space, (slip st, ch 3, 4 tr) in next cl, sc in ch-5 space, * (4 tr, ch 3, slip st) in next cl, (slip st, ch 3, 3 tr, ch 3, slip st) in next ch-1 space, (slip st, ch 3, 4 tr) in next cl, sc in ch-5 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of ch-3 – 30 (33, 36) petals. Fasten off.
Thumb Edging
With right side facing, join thread in any st of thumb opening; ch 2 (counts as first hdc), work 33 (35, 39) more hdc evenly around thumb opening; join with slip st in top of ch-2. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Press edging with warm iron.
FINISHING
With needle and matching thread, sew one pearl bead to top of Edging Round 1 cl in center of each petal grouping, as shown in photo.
